conclusion: Determine the ratio of post-collision velocity to pre-collision velocity of the basketball during its collision with the ground.
Denote v_1 as the velocity just before the first collision and v_2 as the velocity just after the first collision.
Velocity before the first collision (v_1) is determined using energy conservation and work-energy theorem considering air resistance.
Calculate work done by air resistance during descent: W_air = -λmgH.
Solve for v_1: v_1 = sqrt(2gH(1 + λ)).
Velocity after the first collision (v_2) is determined using energy conservation and work-energy theorem considering air resistance.
Calculate work done by air resistance during ascent: W_air = -λmgh.
Solve for v_2: v_2 = sqrt(2gh(1 - λ)).
Determine the ratio of post-collision velocity to pre-collision velocity: v_2/v_1 = sqrt((h(1 - λ))/(H(1 + λ))).
Final answer: The ratio is sqrt((h(1 - λ))/(H(1 + λ))).
